column4: i need some help installing ubuntu. i want to leave my windows partitions and use the empty partition on my harddrive. so im in the manual partition editor in the ubuntu installation. do i create a partition in the empty space and mount point it to / ??
so i dont have make one for home and one for boot ?
It's just sometimes more convienent to have a separate /boot (full-disk encryption) and/or separate /home (easy backups)
But a single / partition is enough.
does it still create boot and home ?
Oh, and don't forget a swap partition.
If /home is not a partition, it will be created as a plain simple directory.
how big should be swap be ?
I think 2x of your RAM is recommended...
